Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2008 05:47AM suz7731 wrote: hugs to you jhawks!! and YAY on the B9 results. i'm also glad that you kept up with these doctors and got the help you needed!! i'm going on thursday to a breast center. was supposed to be last thursday, but the surgeon had surgery. go figure... lots of good thoughts and prayers to help keep you calm for the next 6 months, girl!!
Posts.Title: Misdiagnosed? jhawks67 Shirlann

Posts.Content: suz7731 wrote: hey everyone. i had my appointment at the breast center with a new surgeon. first of all, i really liked this guy. he was informative and caring. he DID NOT feel a definable lump!! he did notice a "bump" (not a lump) under my arm, and i had an us for that which showed nothing as well. i'm not sure if i'm happy or sad. i'm still having the itchy nipple, and a spot that is dimpled in the areola which he says is from the fibrocystic changes disease. he said that my left breast is severely cystic with many glandular something or other. i'm happy that he thinks everything is ok, but sad because i don't feel like i got all the answers i need (or maybe it's because i did not get the answers i "wanted"???)  i go back in 3 months to have a checkup and possible follow-up u/s. thanks for all your good thoughts, prayers and support. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: update on me suz7731 suz7731

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2008 07:49AM suz7731 wrote: i didn't have anything else at this appt. i did have a diagnostic mammo in july. no mri and he did not feel the need for an mri i guess because it was not addressed. but spar2, i'm not sure what to biopsy now. he is saying he does not feel a lump... when i started this whole thing, my ob/gyn felt a lump at the 3o'clock position on my left breast. my gp felt the lump. the first surgeon (general) felt it, then didnt' the second time. because when i asked for a biopsy he practically yelled in my face that there was nothing to biopsy... said it was all in my head and that i needed to get on anti-depressants. the surgeon i saw yesterday was a cancer breast surgeon so i felt a little more confident in his explanations. i'm still nervous though. UGH!
